description:
8.91 haas
Apply Haas effect to audio.

Note that this makes most sense to apply on mono signals.
With this filter applied to mono signals it give some directionality and
stretches its stereo image.

The filter accepts the following options:
name: haas

options.description: Set input level. By default is 1, or 0dB
options.name: level_in

options.description: Set output level. By default is 1, or 0dB.
options.name: level_out

options.description: Set gain applied to side part of signal. By default is 1.
options.name: side_gain

options.description:
Set kind of middle source. Can be one of the following:

‘left’

Pick left channel.

‘right’

Pick right channel.

‘mid’

Pick middle part signal of stereo image.

‘side’

Pick side part signal of stereo image.
options.name: middle_source

options.description: Change middle phase. By default is disabled.
options.name: middle_phase

options.description: Set left channel delay. By default is 2.05 milliseconds.
options.name: left_delay

options.description: Set left channel balance. By default is -1.
options.name: left_balance

options.description: Set left channel gain. By default is 1.
options.name: left_gain

options.description: Change left phase. By default is disabled.
options.name: left_phase

options.description: Set right channel delay. By defaults is 2.12 milliseconds.
options.name: right_delay

options.description: Set right channel balance. By default is 1.
options.name: right_balance

options.description: Set right channel gain. By default is 1.
options.name: right_gain

options.description: Change right phase. By default is enabled.
options.name: right_phase
